subject: Re: [PATCH v4 07/25] io_uring/kbuf: add recycling for kernel managed buffer rings

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer clarified that kernel-managed buffer rings (kmbufs) are used for non-zero-copyable payloads and have a separate purpose from zero-copying, which is done through registered buffers.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb raised a question about the possibility of io_uring_fixed_index_get() returning NULL, and provided Reviewed-by tag

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Bernd Schubert reviewed several patches in the series, pointing out minor issues and requesting documentation additions.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Reviewer Bernd Schubert raised concerns about initialization of cs->len in fuse_copy_fill and pointed out a potential exception in the recycling logic for kernel-managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Christoph Hellwig
reviews.summary: Christoph Hellwig suggested splitting the patch series into smaller ones for easier review and raised several technical concerns about specific patches.

reviews.author: Askar Safin
reviews.summary: The reviewer questioned whether the kernel-managed buffer rings (kbufs) solve the same problem as splice, and if kbuf is a modern replacement for splice.
